title: MAKE CONTENT MORE FUN TO LEARN EASY
description: Guidelines need more media and sound for interesting and understanding easier

f6_assessments.q0: This is a project to create approximately twenty-four 15-min videos over the course of 6 months, to be voiced in Vietnamese and subtitled in English.  These videos would focus on creating learning material based around guides and resources in Cardano and Project Catalyst, but the approach would be explainers on whiteboards, possibly with animations.  The point would be to use highly visual examples to do explanations, and if a person searches around Youtube, you can find this popular style being used throughout the Crypto space to explain complicated DAOs or difficult tokenomics, and there are multiple platforms for users to create their own.  This seems like a really great idea (and as of Feb 2022 Vietnam was the the highest ranked user of cryptocurrency in terms of valuation of transaction and of individuals engaging in transactions...and 2nd place wasn't even close) and the proposer has already been working on creating these videos.  The opensourcing of the underlying video content, in order to allow reuse with other languages, is a huge perk.
f6_assessments.q1: The skills required seem evident based on the provided sample, and the proposer has provided a good plan to increase the quality even more, by getting dedicated voice talent and bringing on content writers, creators and editors.  The timeline provided is a bit sparse, with most of the details in the first two phases already accomplished, and little detail in the post funding phase, however the budget is well laid out and sufficiently captures the steps required to roll out each of the videos.  The schedule roughly works out to one video released per week, and that schedule takes into account the initial process of assembling a production team over the first months after funding.  It isn't indicated if the team is perhaps already ready and awaiting funding, or will need to be completely sourced after funding.  The content used to create the videos will be organized as articles on a website, which can increase the exposure and the mileage from the work.  The proposal doesn't clarify how it will distribute the opensource video for others to use, but that could be accomplished via the website repository or even on GitHub.  The budget is quite reasonable on a per video basis, and only adds up because of the large number of videos to be created.  24 is an ambitious goal on a tight timeline, and the only real risk I see with this project is overrunning either the budget or the delivery date.
f6_assessments.q2: The only place where the work will be tracked is the youtube playlist of the proposer, however they have budget for marketing so it can be assumed that the community will be able to follow developments as they advertise and build up social media following.  There is a bit of concern regarding the timeframe between funding (around May or so) and the expected startup date for creating videos (expected to be July) as that is a couple of months without anything obvious to report progress on.  However I believe we can assume that this buffer is being built-in in case there are any funding delays (won't need to move timeline in negotiations with contributors) and in a pinch the proposer can make progress reports based on getting their team assembled.  Once production starts the auditing should be a simple process of reporting how many videos have been made and progress towards total amount expected.  The proposer could also include metrics on views, and number of pull requests for the opensource videos.  In terms of some of the deeper implications of the challenge setting, it would be a real positive for this proposer to seek out talented creatives to do the drawing and voice work, and to consider making a report, interview or article on the process, to inspire and help others who are seeking creatives to work with them, or seeking creative work.

But, for less cost and to make another professional team that just focus on Catalyst & Cardano, I have to make this plan first.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea is nice and the structure and approach of the content seems to make sense. Having short videos to explain general concepts are good and the solutions address the problem raised. Targeting Vietnam audience is interesting as most of the content is in english. It would be nice though to have mentionted here what is the potential of the country in terms possible future Cardano members (Country population, number of students, of people who owns crypto there, something like this). I like there's already one demo clip to show how it would work. I also see this proposal aligned with the challenge, addressing kpis as "# of multimedia projects", "# of multilingual teams" and "# of decentralised multimedia projects sharing resources (eg RAW footage) to avoid unnecessary costs and CO2 emissions from travelling to shoot footage on site".
As suggestions, it would be imporant to see here a proper communication plan to make this video reach all Vietnam potential new members and even out of Vietnam, once it will have english subtitles. I liked the risk identified and its plan to mitigate it but it is possible to go beyond and think of other risks involving video quality, project schedule and costs, not reaching target audience and so on. It would be imporant to see a mitigation strategy for them.
f6_assessments.q1:

I liked though that proposal already know the positions he needs for the project (and I agree with them).
